alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 4:10AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. A weather observer near Midway airport measured 1.45 inches of rainfall between 2 AM and 4 AM. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following county, Cook. * WHEN...Until 715 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 408 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, Hammond, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Calumet City, Chicago Lawn, Midway Airport, Roseland, Englewood, South Lawndale, Bridgeport, South Shore, Chicago Loop, Burbank, Oak Forest, Harvey and Blue Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
